track the.rêge vs ma.rêge reach regel 𓂾:

MURGU 𒈱𒋞 ⇔ मार्ग mārga (road) march ⇔ merging Meer 𓈗 ?
MA.EGIR 𒈱 길 gil ڕێگە rêge орук oruk < سڑک saṛak street
𓈘 = maroadan 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔ 𓈘𓊢𓏏𓉐=𓅓𓊢𓏏𓉐 mastaba

𓌻 𓂋 𓈘 MURGU 𒈱𒋞 Afroasiatic *m-r “river, channel”
Omotic *mir- “river”, with reflexes including Aari mɨri “river, stream” and Dime mɪ́rɛ “river”. A possible Semitic cognate is Sabaean 𐩣𐩧 (mr, “part of an irrigation system”. Possible Cushitic cognates include Borana Oromo mērī “watering trough”, Tsamai mīre “pond”, and possible Chadic cognates include Fali mirə̂ “river”, Muskum mìrà “oxbow lake, marigot”.

𓈘 𓈇 𓀀 𓏥 𓁐 | weavers | 𓌦 √rotor?
𓌻 𓂋 𓏏 𓀀 𓏥 𓁐 | weavers, servants, underlings
𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 maroad street

𓈘 ⋍ 𓌻 𓂋 𓏏 ⋍ road

𓌻 𓂋 𓏏 𓀀 𓏥 𓁐 gérdios γέρδιος “chorder” weavers @ guard
𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 geroad : street (⇔ EGIR 𒈱 길 gil ڕێگە rêge орук oruk طْريق ṭrīq track )
𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 geroad : Gerade (straight) gata > Gasse
𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 geroad ⇔ *greutą “grit, gravel“ Geröll

𓈘 𓈇 𓈖 𓃀 𓈔 | axe | MaGeRodni? Beil > roden (uprooting, rid trees)

EGIR 𒈱 Weger GeWeg כְּבִישׁ k'vish

𓈖 𒈝 ⋍ 𒌫 ⋍ 𓈘 river

derivate derive dē+rīvō drive
From Proto-Italic *rīwos, from Proto-Indo-European *h₃riH-wó-s, from *h₃reyH-.
rīvus
A small stream (of water); brook, stream, rivulet
An artificial watercourse; channel, conduit, canal.
A gutter.
(figuratively, of a liquid) A stream.

𓅓 𓊃 𓏏 𓄹 𓈓 mzt Milz ⋍ liver
𓏇 𓇋 𓋴 𓏏 𓄹 𓏤 mīst Milz ⋍ liver
𓈘 𓈇 𓋴 𓏏 𓄹 {marga}st milest Milz ⋍ liver

𒀀𒊒 ᶠa'ruᵈ flood 𓈘
